title: Grand Palace Bangkok - Thailand's Crown Jewel

caption.default: ✨ The Grand Palace has been the heart of Thailand for over 200 years! Home to the sacred Emerald Buddha and showcasing incredible Thai architecture. A must-visit in Bangkok! 🏛️
caption.facebook:
🏛️ THE GRAND PALACE - Bangkok's #1 Must-See! 👑

📍 Built in 1782, this magnificent complex has been home to Thai Kings for 150 years!

✨ Don't miss:
• Temple of the Emerald Buddha
• Throne Halls with stunning murals
• Traditional Thai architecture at its finest

⏰ Open: 8:30 AM - 3:30 PM
🎫 Tickets: 500 THB
👗 Dress code: Strict! Cover shoulders & knees

💡 Pro tip: Arrive early to beat crowds and heat!
caption.instagram:
👑 GRAND PALACE BANGKOK 🏛️

Thailand's most visited attraction! ✨

📸 Best photo spots:
• Golden Chedi sunrise shot
• Emerald Buddha Temple
• Demon Guardian statues

⏰ Visit: 8:30-15:30
🎫 Entry: 500 THB
👗 Dress code: STRICT!

💡 Beat the crowds - arrive at opening!

title: Wat Arun - Temple of Dawn

caption.default: 🌅 Wat Arun (Temple of Dawn) sparkles with millions of porcelain pieces! This riverside temple offers the best sunset views in Bangkok. Climb the steep steps for unforgettable panoramas! 🛕
caption.facebook:
🌅 WAT ARUN - Bangkok's Most Photogenic Temple! 🛕

Known as the Temple of Dawn, this stunning landmark is decorated with millions of colorful porcelain pieces that shimmer in the sunlight!

📸 Photography heaven:
• Best at sunset (despite the name!)
• Climb 79m for panoramic river views
• Stunning when lit up at night

⏰ Open: 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM
🎫 Entry: 100 THB
⛴️ Take the ferry from Tha Tien Pier (4 THB)

💡 Insider tip: Visit from Wat Pho pier for the best photos OF Wat Arun!
caption.instagram:
🌅 WAT ARUN - Temple of Dawn 🛕

Bangkok's most Instagrammable temple! 📸

✨ Fun facts:
• 79m tall spire
• Millions of porcelain pieces
• Best photos at sunset
• Only 4 THB ferry ride!

📍 Pro tip: Snap pics FROM across river!
⏰ Golden hour: 5-6 PM

imageAlt: Wat Arun temple at sunset Bangkok

title: Doi Suthep - Chiang Mai's Sacred Mountain Temple

caption.default: ⛰️ Doi Suthep temple sits 1,073m above Chiang Mai! Climb 309 steps flanked by mythical Naga serpents to reach this golden temple. The views over the city are absolutely breathtaking! 🏔️
caption.facebook:
⛰️ DOI SUTHEP - Chiang Mai's Guardian Temple! 🏔️

Perched high on the mountain, this sacred temple watches over Chiang Mai city!

🪜 The journey:
• 309 steps with Naga serpent railings
• OR take the cable car (20 THB)
• Golden chedi contains Buddha relics
• Panoramic views of Chiang Mai

⏰ Open: 6:00 AM - 6:00 PM
🎫 Entry: 30 THB
🚐 Songthaew from city: 50-100 THB

☀️ Best time: Early morning for cool weather & monk chanting
📸 Sunset = magical golden hour photos!
caption.instagram:
⛰️ DOI SUTHEP TEMPLE 🏔️

Chiang Mai's must-visit mountain temple! 🇹🇭

🪜 309 steps to heaven
🌅 Epic city views
✨ Golden chedi shines!

💡 Hacks:
• Beat heat - go at 6 AM
• Hear monks chanting
• Cable car available!

📍 30 min from Old City

imageAlt: Doi Suthep temple golden chedi Chiang Mai

title: Ayutthaya Historical Park - Ancient Capital Ruins

caption.default: 🏛️ Step back in time at Ayutthaya, Thailand's ancient capital! This UNESCO World Heritage site features stunning temple ruins, massive Buddha statues, and 600 years of history just 80km from Bangkok! 🛕
caption.facebook:
🏛️ AYUTTHAYA - Thailand's Ancient Capital! 🛕

📍 Just 1.5 hours from Bangkok lies this incredible UNESCO World Heritage site!

🔍 Must-see temples:
• Wat Mahathat - Buddha head in tree roots
• Wat Phra Si Sanphet - 3 iconic chedis
• Wat Chaiwatthanaram - Stunning sunset spot
• Wat Lokayasutharam - 37m reclining Buddha

🚲 Best explored by bicycle (50 THB/day)
🎫 Combined ticket: 220 THB for 6 temples
⏰ Open: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

💡 Pro tip: Stay overnight to see temples lit up without crowds!
caption.instagram:
🏛️ AYUTTHAYA RUINS 🛕

Thailand's ancient capital! 📸

✨ Instagram gold:
• Buddha head in tree roots
• 3 golden chedis
• Sunset at riverside temples
• 37m reclining Buddha

🚲 Rent a bike: 50 THB
📍 1.5hr from Bangkok
🎫 6 temples: 220 THB

title: White Temple (Wat Rong Khun) - Chiang Rai's Modern Marvel

caption.default: ❄️ The White Temple in Chiang Rai is unlike any temple you've seen! This contemporary masterpiece by artist Chalermchai Kositpipat features intricate white sculptures and mirror mosaics that sparkle in the sun! ✨
caption.facebook:
❄️ WHITE TEMPLE - Thailand's Most Unique Temple! ✨

Wat Rong Khun is a stunning contemporary art exhibit in the form of a Buddhist temple!

🎨 Created by artist Chalermchai Kositpipat
❄️ Pure white with mirror fragments
😱 Features pop culture references
📸 Every angle is photo-worthy!

⏰ Open: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM
🎫 Entry: 100 THB
📍 13km south of Chiang Rai city

⚠️ Rules: No photos inside main building
💡 Visit early morning for best photos & smaller crowds
🚌 Blue buses from Chiang Rai: 20 THB
caption.instagram:
❄️ WHITE TEMPLE CHIANG RAI ✨

Thailand's most artistic temple! 🎨

📸 Insta tips:
• Sparkling white & mirrors
• Bridge of Rebirth shot
• Golden building contrast
• Unique sculptures everywhere!

⏰ 8 AM = best light
🎫 100 THB entry
📍 20 min from city

imageAlt: White Temple Wat Rong Khun Chiang Rai
